Palayamkottai Cathedral’s tower clock older than Big Ben of London
description: A routine inspection of the tower clock at the historic Holy Trinity Cathedral in Palayamkottai, Tirunelveli, has led to a remarkable revelation: the 171‑year‑old timepiece predates London’s iconic Big Ben by five years. Antique clock collector Robert Kennedy and master clocksmith Nagaraj, invited by the church to assess the clock’s failing chime, found that the mechanism was manufactured in 1854 by John Moore & Sons of Clerkenwell and installed in 1855 making it possibly the oldest functioning tower clock in India.

Russia rejects Alexei Navalny poisoning charge, 'naturally'
description: Russia has dismissed accusations from European nations that it poisoned Alexei Navalny with epibatidine as "biased and baseless."  Britain, Sweden, France, Germany and the Netherlands said in a joint statement on Saturday that they believe Navalny was poisoned with epibatidine, a toxic substance derived from poison dart frogs. While the US is not disputing the charge, it has refrained from direct comments. Navalny, a prominent critic of Vladimir Putin, died in February 2024 at an Arctic penal colony.

title: Bihar employment scheme: CM Nitish Kumar transfers ₹2,500 crore to 25 lakh women
description: State Government, so far, transferred ₹18,100 crore to bank accounts of 1.81 crore women beneficiaries under the scheme

title: Watch: Om Birla to attend Bangladesh PM Tarique Rahman’s oath ceremony
description: India has nominated Om Birla to represent the country at the swearing-in ceremony of Bangladesh Nationalist Party leader Tarique Rahman as Prime Minister on February 17 in Dhaka. Prime Minister Narendra Modi declined the invitation due to prior commitments, including engagements with French President Emmanuel Macron. Rahman’s appointment follows the ouster of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina in 2024. Birla’s participation signals India’s intent to maintain continuity in bilateral ties, even as New Delhi cautiously evaluates its approach toward the new BNP-led government amid recent diplomatic strains.

title: Kanye West to make his India debut with a concert in March
description: The concert is part of his global run of headline performances and will take place in New Delhi’s Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium

title: Pakistan: 2 killed, 14 injured in IED blast in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa
description: A bomb blast near a police station in Pakistan's Bannu district has claimed at least two lives, including a child, and injured 14 others. The improvised explosive device, reportedly a time bomb attached to a motorcycle, detonated near shops. Authorities have cordoned off the area and launched a search operation, with officials condemning the act as an attack on peace.

title: Rajpal Yadav gets relief: Delhi HC grants interim bail in cheque bounce case
description: Actor Rajpal Yadav has been granted interim bail by the Delhi High Court in cheque bounce cases after depositing Rs 1.5 crore. The court suspended his sentence, allowing him to remain out of custody until March 18, with conditions including a personal bond and surety. His wife expressed gratitude for industry support amidst speculation about debt repayment.

title: Rohit Shetty residence firing case: Mumbai Crime Branch nabs main shooter
description: The Mumbai Police Crime Branch has successfully detained the lead gunman connected to the recent shooting incident at the home of filmmaker Rohit Shetty in Rajasthan, alongside five other individuals. With this latest roundup, the tally of arrests reaches eleven, with further actions taken in Uttar Pradesh.

title: Road crash victims to get cashless treatment: PM RAHAT claim limit, process explained
description: The government has launched the PM RAHAT scheme, offering cashless treatment up to Rs 1.5 lakh for road accident victims. This initiative aims to provide crucial medical care within the 'Golden Hour,' with a seven-day cover and quick claim settlement. Victims or Good Samaritans can access the service by dialing 112.

title: Toyota Urban Cruiser Ebella: Toyota’s quiet electric thesis for urban India
description: Toyota’s first serious electric SUV for India arrives not with bravado, but with intent—an EV that feels engineered to be lived with, not talked about The Urban Cruiser Ebella is less a statement of disruption and more a carefully argued case for how mainstream electric mobility should feel.

Firefighters battled for hours to control the inferno.

Anthropic refuses to allow its AI for mass surveillance of citizens or fully autonomous weapons, frustrating defense officials. While other companies are more accommodating, Anthropic's firm stance on ethical guardrails could lead to a complete termination of their collaboration.
